content:
Those are excellent suggestions! I can see how building in some quiet time in the morning could really help me feel more centered and focused. I think I'll try incorporating a 15-20 minute reading or journaling session into my morning routine.

I also like the idea of setting a reminder on my phone to remind me to put it away for the first 30 minutes after waking up. And placing my phone outside of my bedroom is a great tip - it's amazing how much of a difference it can make just by removing the temptation to check my phone first thing in the morning.

Establishing a consistent wake-up routine is also a great idea. I think I'll try making my bed and doing a quick 5-minute yoga routine to get my blood flowing. It's simple, but it can help signal to my brain that it's time to start the day.

You know, I think I've been making my mornings too complicated by trying to fit in too much at once. Simplifying my routine and focusing on self-care and relaxation might be just what I need to feel more energized and refreshed.

Thanks so much for your help and guidance! I feel like I have a better plan in place now to improve my morning routine and prioritize my well-being.
